page.title: 16The River Maun Landscape 2
page.content: Local farms set amidst the rolling countryside are positioned near the valley, sheltered by copses. They are remnants of the former "Dukeries". Many old farm buildings date back to that era. The large fields contain mainly crops. Although on Warren Farm at least there are sheep and bovines raised for meat. Within the coniferous plantations there remain some of the old oaks of the former extensive Sherwood forest. Some of these are named in particular Parliament and Old Churn Oak. A feature of the area surrounding Clipstone is the ease of access to the countryside. With the many forestry roads and the criss-crossing of old tracks, the landscape is available to all.
